newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Seven says case settled favourably.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Seven says case settled favourably.

text.p: Television operator Seven Network Ltd said legal action in the Supreme Court of New South Wales involving the broadcast of Rugby Union had been settled on terms favourable to the company.

"Seven Network Ltd advises that the rugby union case... between Optus Vision Pty Ltd, Seven Network Ltd, Australian Rugby Football Union Ltd, The News Corp Ld and others has been settled on terms financially advantageous to Seven Network Ltd," the company said in a statement.
The company said it could not reveal the exact terms of the settlement due to a confidentiality agreement.

Optus Vision, one of Australia's two major pay television operators and 45 percent-owned by Optus Communications, began the legal action in April this year after New Corp struck a US$608 million international rugby union deal with the sport's governing bodies in Australia, New Zealand, and South Africa. News Corp and Telstra jointly own the other key pay tv group in Australia, Foxtel.
Seven is a two percent shareholder in Optus Vision and has the free-to-air rugby union distribution rights in Australia.
